title: Jean Sibelius
summary: Jean Sibelius (/sɪˈbeɪliəs/ sib-AY-lee-əs;[1] Finland Swedish: [ˈjɑːn siˈbeːliʉs, ˈʃɑːn -] (listen); born Johan Julius Christian Sibelius,[2] 8 December 1865 – 20 September 1957) was a Finnish composer and violinist of the late Romantic and early-modern periods. He is widely recognized as his country's greatest composer, and his music is often credited with having helped Finland develop a national identity during its struggle for independence from Russia.
